Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2011 10:35AM moe0279 wrote: ScienceGirl, I also finished taxol #4 with avastin and have numbness in my toes...Im taking L-glutamine, but this week its not helping...it is a little scary to think it could be permanent, i go back on tuesday to #5 and wonder how they will handle it...before i started taking the glutamine, i had hot flashes thru my hands and feet..since ive only had that a couple of times.  i wonder if they will decrease the meds...this scares me too because i want to get everything i can to kill this stuff!  ive already had to skip one treatment because of liver levels being to high.  if anyone has any ideas they would be helpful...i have heard that b12 might help...but i wonder again if im taking all these different things how can there not be some reactions

Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2011 03:22AM moe0279 wrote: Hope everyone is having a great weekend! Taxol has officially stacked up in my body... Fridays and saturdays have been my hardest day, but this week I had to leave work early on Friday I was so exhausted that I knew I couldn't stay...it was so frustrating, now I cant seem to shake the fatigue and tiredness....I'm on taxol #6, has anyone experienced this with taxol...ive also had this shaky feeling that doesn't seem to go away. Its like the steroid high, but not...it's hard to explain....I feel like I have a sinus infection with a sore throat, no fever so I hesitate going to the dr..should...or just wait until chemo on Tuesday...if I'm not running a fever will a sinus infection effect blood counts....I'm feeling really naive about all this, I feel like I should know what to do for every ache and pain...

I feel so blessed to be able to enjoy all the holiday festivities and family gatherings...I really didn't think i would be able to do much...

Has anyone's fingers been tender..Ive notices little black specks in my nails..any suggestions..I have put clear nail polish on them to try and keep them strong, but not sure what will work! meme31, warriorprincess is definitely welcome here...please tell her we are here for her...it breaks my heart to think someone is lonely and needs to talk....

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2011 09:35PM moe0279 wrote: Hi girls, I just have to say God is amazing....my tumor has reduced in size...the Dr. confirmed my suspicions.... YIPEE!  I on a high from such good news On the other hand, blood counts were good but liver test showed elevated levels 405 instead of 245..tested 2 times just in case.So no chemo today will try again next week if levels go down...I was really disapointed because this appt will not be made up...I worry that if i miss an infusion then it will stop working....i know its not logical, they assured me that missing one would not make that bit of a difference...but i still worryi...has anyone had this happen yet? I also have to take bp meds...my bp has been up for the last 2 treatments...oh well i guess all this goes with the territory!   Hope everyone had a great day, im thinking of everyone!

Posts.Content: Jan 2, 2011 07:03PM moe0279 wrote: lee7, i wanted to jump in and say that I also teach and we have the same rule...but my prinipal is very understanding and said i could wear anything I like...I even think im going to try to make hats ok for my classroom...or possibly the school during lunch, pe, etc..make it a school wide event...Talk to him or her they should understand...I hoping by that point im going to be ready to go without hair...but definintly not there yet...i still get emotional when i think about lossing my hair. Tuesday will be my 3rd taxol treatment so im sure its going to start sometime soon...here's a couple sites you can get free wraps...they are wonderful caring organizations...you can also get wigs at your local cancer centers and i think that the ACS gives a coupon to help pay for a wig (although i haven't check that out)...You can sign up for a Look Good, Feel Better and they will work with you to put on make-up after you loose eyebrows and lashes...(i don't wear anything except mascara and eye liner, so i need any help i can get...lol) www.francelux.com and www.gailafund.org hope this helps
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2011 07:55AM moe0279 wrote: proud mom...as for numbing cream...it works great..put a layer on a piece of saran wrap 30-45 minutes before infusion..I didn't feel a thing...it was wondeful!!!! they will give you prescription for it...sometime they have numbing spray also, but i like the cream better!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: Jan 6, 2011 05:34AM moe0279 wrote: slsct12, i agree with the wigs...i have been to 2 cancer centers who have given me wigs...One was expecially great..she spent over an hour working with me and i left with 2 wigs...both dark red...my normal color is sandy blond...but i loved them.. i left with lots of information and shampoo, they also gave me hats to wear to bed and out and about....I would call around locally and find a center that will work for you...I know i can afford wigs in addition to all the extra meds and dr appts.   You can also find a Look Good, Feel Better program locally thru the ACS...They will help with wigs, makeup and apprently lots of other things...I have an appointment on the 3 monday in Jan..I will let you know how it goes...Also you can take the wigs once you get them to a beauty shop who specializes in wigs and they will cut and thin it to match you...i have to do that also...ACS has wigs for low prices...$40-60..check out their website..  i think im going to have to start wearing my wigs this week or at the beginning of next week...im on the 3rd dose of taxol and avastin...really nervous...but i think i might die it blue for a day...lol...need to keep it silly or im afraid i will be devastated when the boys and i shave it...  I received my wraps quickly, with sweet notes.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2011 06:58PM moe0279 wrote: slcst12, im so sorry that your local cancer center doesnt do anything...you might look or ask around when you are getting chemo... warriorprincess, I did get the runny nose and had to pee A LOT!..I'm eager to hear how the shot goes tomorrow..  Tomorrow is my first appt with my ocon since I started Chemo...Im so eager for her to feel the lump to see if it has changed...is it normal for it to change shape, i can't seem to find it as well and its seems smaller...I almost afraid to get my hopes up... i wonder if they can change so fast...tomorrow is just a taxol day, but we will be there for 5-7 hrs...it always takes forever!

Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: Mar 16, 2011 04:38PM moe0279 wrote: Hey ladies, its been a while since I last posted, I have been keeping up with everyone...congratulations to those of you who have finished tx...I extremely happy to say I've finished my 12 weekly taxol tx... Here's a low down on my side effects with taxol....very little nausea only a couple of times, constipation, diaheria, hemmroids, (those 3were constant every week) sore mouth, RASH on chest and chin....not sure if that from taxol or steroids, right big toe and pads of feet numb. At the beginning I had hot flashes thru my hands and feet, I took l-glutimime for the neuropathy...it's funny because I would say that taxol was not that bad...I only missed tx day and 2 other days during the 3 months...my hair started to fall out, but now it's growing and been growing for about6 weeks..so good news for those who have lost their hair... My first few tx took a while but once they my sure your not going to have reactions, they will probably up the flow...at the end I was getting finished with taxol in about 2 hrs...I didn't have to take nausea meds or neulasta during taxol...have colase, imodium, and gas x on hand....lol...u just don't know which you will need..I've tried head and shoulders for the rash, steroid cream and hydicortozone...steroid cream worked the best. Now that i'm aal done with this round and have 2 weeks off, I seem to be having more side effects...lots more fatigue...has anyone else had this problem...my feet, hands, muscles have been cramping like crazy....my nose is completely raw. And I feel exhausted and shake all the time..I talked with my onco about this and she says it the withdrawal from steroids and of course the tx... On march29 I will have my first tx of AC... I'm so nervous, can anyone tell me what to expect with the first tx...I'm not sure if I should take that first week off work or plan to work...I have a great principal and she will work with me...I can't seem to shake this fear of AC...just thinking about makes me want to cry...I know I will get thru it, but I'm scared...thanks all for listening...
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: Apr 1, 2011 05:17PM moe0279 wrote: Hi, ladies...its been a different week!  I will say to all who have had dense dose AC are amazing...After the 12 weeks of Taxol, that AC is definitely hard core.  I had my first treatment Tuesday and I have worked all week, but with lots of nausea, heartburn, and exhaustion. I almost feel spoiled with Taxol!  I feel like im taking so many nausea meds that I'm wondering if i should be still feeling nausea.  I seem to want to eat potatoes and starchy things.. What made all of you feel better...any particular foods, drinks...water and vitimans make my tummy turn...anyone else experience this.  Any suggestions to get thru this...I have the guilt of not being able to get up and go and having 2 boys, 6 and 4..makes me feel even worse...I did take the neulasta wed. and have not had any bone pain yet... Did anyone find that their moods were short?  Ive been crying and emotional one day and grumpy the next day....Does it even out?  Anyone have any allergic reactions to any of the new meds, nausea meds, AC...anything? Thanks for listening and telling me about your experience with AC
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2011 02:21PM moe0279 wrote: avastin...here's this sites link for avastin www.breastcancer.org/treatment/druglist/avastin.jsp Im going to UNC and this is one of there clinical trials for Triple Negative so i opted to have whatever they could give me! and i keep telling them anything else they want to give me they can...they always just laugh at me saying im a "chemo junkie" lol
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2011 08:38AM moe0279 wrote: Taxol hasn't been horrible, much less than what everyone says about the AC...I only take nausea meds 1 to 2 times a week!..my hair started falling out, but is now growing and Im on tx #7...Im sure during the AC part i will loose it all, but oh well! I have constipation, diaherra, heartburn...Fatigue and tiredness.. I get treatment on tuesdays and Fridays are my worst day...i just sleep alot once i get home from school...Ive worked thru taxol except for one day and i came home an hour early..I can tell that tx's are stacking up, because im more tired the day of chemo and the days after...ive been very blessed to have such mild side effects...hope this helps!  melissa
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: Feb 13, 2011 07:38AM moe0279 wrote: Start last week of 12/10: Taxol x12 #7, next acx 4 Girls i have a question...this week has sort of been weird with se's...I've started my period...its very heavy and clotty..(THI) has this happened to anyone else..I've also had more nose bleeds..I'm going to mention it to on tuesday when i go in for chemo, but wondering if i should call ahead about it...My big toes have been sort of numb, but now it feels like my tongue has been burned...it just feels different?  Ive been drinking my l-glutamine, but i guess its not a miracle cure...This week has been so much more tough, ive felt bumbed and down in the dumps...Ive really tried to stay positive thru this because i know being negative isn't going to help...does anyone else sometime just want to go to bed and cry...I feel guilty everytime i need to lie down, or just feel rotten...It drives me crazy to not have the energy to clean the house, play with the kiddos, or even watch tv......Sorry to vent, Im hoping that venting here will help get me out of my funk!! I hope everyone has a wonderful Sunday and Happy Valentines Day..You girls always make me feel better!!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: Jan 6, 2011 03:27AM moe0279 wrote: good luck today baf4292 and any others that are starting....my biggest suggestion is relax...i know its so hard, i will be praying for you! for me the first tx was the hardest because i didn't know what to expect... Im taking 30g of glutamine a day to help with the neropathy in fingers and toes..since ive been taking it i've not had any more burning sensations in my  hand in feet...weird huh...my ocon's suggestions is to take it the day of chemo and then 4 days after...i think i will check to make sure that is the right dosage...thanks for the info proudmom... Im also not endorsing this supplement..but am will to try anything! I read that onco score is for ladies that have ER+?   Snowed here today so im out of school so i get to take it easy...Worked yesterday for the first time since Christmas vacation...Had a great day seeing my kiddos at school...so glad that this chemo hasn't stopped me from going to work at this point...i was very tired so i came home and vegged and then went to sleep with my boys at 8:30...feeling good this morning...i think the steroid have me up this early morning... I love have all you ladies here to listen when i ramble! Thanks bunches
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: Jan 7, 2011 03:33AM moe0279 wrote: Ladies...I want to say go to your local Cancer Centers...They have new wigs for BC patients...I have 3 new wigs that were given to me...I had one really great experience in which the lady was wonderful, helpful and eager to find me something that was for me..I spent over an hour trying on many different wigs...My other experiece i was rushed...i did leave with a wig which i like, but ive decided not to go back there for any help...I plan on sharing my wigs back with these center as soon as im able...They gave me shampoo, care tips, hats, scarves...and lots and lots of information...The ACS has a nice website with wigs and hats, and scarves... Hope this helps!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: Mar 16, 2011 05:53PM moe0279 wrote: Thanks ladies...it nice here from ladies that have actually gone thru it...
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: Jan 13, 2011 06:24AM moe0279 wrote: ScienceGirl,  I love your story about your son..I teach children on the spectrum and how they would react to my hair was a worry for me...I had hair down to the middle of my back and so any changes can throw my kiddos for a loop....I got it cut 2 weeks before i started chemo....When i went info for the first time since christmas one little boy look at me and "ooooh Mrs. Parker your hair's beautiful" and another boy who is low on the spectrum wouldn't even look at me until almost the end of the day...lol their reactions are all so varied...another little boy started calling me another teacher's name joking or "tricking me"...What a complete joy my kiddos are, they are precious and adorable! I'm ready for all this snow to go away so i can get back to my babes at school!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: Jan 13, 2011 08:33PM moe0279 wrote: be careful with Tylenol...It increases liver levels and if levels are high, they will not give infusion...Anyone have any suggestions for achy bones...Im really trying to stay away from Tylenol, Advil, and alieve especially until my next treatment...but at night before bed my body just aches...
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2011 12:59PM moe0279 wrote: I just feel strongly about a bilateral mast...My doctor seems to think that a lumpectomy will have the same results as a mastectomy, but she knows at 32, 31 at diagnosis that I must do what I feel is best.  I know what they say, but I know for me its a personal choice.  I think you have to follow your heart and do what best for YOU!  Good luck! and pray about it, you will do what is right for you!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2011 09:15PM moe0279 wrote: today was my first day in public without hair...toughest day yet!  I just couldn't decide this morning if i should wear a wig.hat or scarf....In the end i decided on a wig...I was so nervous going around people i knew..is that strange...it took me a while to leave my classroom...once i did everyone was so great about it...by the time i left at 11:30 i my confidence back and more confidence to go without a wig and wear a scarf...so as i was driving home off came the wig..no more itching and scratchiness ...freedom!  i hope no one was passing, if so, i would have loved to see t hat expression!!! As soon as i got home i put on a pink bandana and it felt great..went to the mall, and did a little shopping, hung out with my sister who always helps my confidence, and when with her for her first mammogram!! Yippee im so glad she went! now i have to get my mom back in there!!! although she's already had one in the last 6 months!  So I have decided to scratch the wigs for now and wear what I feel the most comfortable in, I almost feel like i wore the wig to make everyone else feel better (sounds strange, i know)...I love the scarves...i think they are more me..I would have never known if i hadn't wore the wig today so in the end it was a blessing...
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: Jan 22, 2011 07:32PM moe0279 wrote: Ok girls my shaved head is itching like crazy...any ideas, anyone else had any problems with razor burn...ya know they tell you about these kinds of things...lol I do have to say it's great wearing scarves and bandanas, much more me, so my wigs r there if I ever decide to wear them!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: Jan 25, 2011 07:54PM moe0279 wrote: hi ladies, i talked with my oncon about the numb toes and she said that it was normal and if it became a problem (balance, running in to things, brusing) then we would consider decreasing dosage...I ask about B12 and she said that i should be getting it thru food....can anyone give me ideas about foods to eat for b12...im also continuing to take the l-glutamine... as for hair with taxol first....my hair did not start falling out until day 25...after my 3rd treatment...once i started getting handfuls i shaved it..i couldn't hand the worry of it anymore...and of course its going to fall out with ddAC.   jcoutee, looks like we will have the same treatment...I am currently on treatment #5 of taxol and its the first week that ive not felt great after treatment...i have been very tired today.  Up until yesterday mondays were my best days of the week...Friday and Saturdays were the worst...tiredness, fatigue, but nothing major...I only have to take the nausea meds about 2 days each week..In the beginning I had thrush, mouth sores, really dry nose, diarrhea, constipation...but all manageable...go to the chemo tips board and it will give you lots of ideas on being prepared for the side effects...it go me thru everything.  I also am participating in a clinical trial with avastin...the good news my tumor has reduced from a 2.5 cm to the size of bb's
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: May 25, 2011 11:58AM moe0279 wrote: christine, No im not having reconstruction until after radiation...the surgeon said i would have drains for about 2 weeks..I just feel so worried about everything...
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2011 07:40PM moe0279 wrote: hi ladies, its been a week or so since ive posted...my se's have been harder this past week, very tired and fatigued...more heartburn..and oh my have i gained weight....has this happened to anyone else, My ocon keeps telling me that its the steroids and chemopause...ive even been drinking 8 cups of h2o for the last 2 weeks...I also started walking for about 25 minutes at the YMCA 2 times this week and hopefully one or 2 more days this week... I wanted to tell everyone about my trip to UNC with my boys yesterday.. My oldest son (6 years old) is a worry wort...he has been having difficult monday's each week since i started having chemo..so i had an idea for the boys to come see me at the hospital while i get chemo...My ocon and the head nurse thought it was a good idea and let us have a private chemo room...and they got to stay the whole time...While i slept they got to explore the hospital with my DH and mom...I felt like it was so beneficial for them to see the process. Now Ayden knows "mom's not bleeding to death each time you get chemo"  Who knew that was what he was so worried about...i wouldn't have know that had i not asked him yesterday... They were so good and well behaved that the head nurse invited them back anytime...we let them take a camera to take pictures to share with their classrooms...here's my caring bridge page with their pictures!!! www.caringbridge.org/visit/melissaparker1 jcoutee, I just finish taxol #6 yesterday...I believe that the tx are stacking up...I actually slept most of the ride home yesterday...Im glad your se's are not so bad... JulieH, I also work at a school.  I will eventually go commando...the other teacher and faculty have been so supportive of this whole process.  We have a Wear it Wednesday each week after my treatment..Its been so great!  The teachers answer the students questions as they come...My son's teacher has let him talk to the class about the whole process as much as he wants...Its great to have support at school..The students will be able to handle it..if they have questions then just answer them as honestly as possible...The parents of my students were glad i had a talk with them...there was no way i could hide the fact that was had no hair...so now as a class we wear scarf, hats and bandannas... I started using hydrcortizone (sp?) cream for my sore itchy head!!!!  I hope everyone has a good week with few side effects....
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2011 03:00AM moe0279 wrote: JeanH, eat ice while getting chemo, I've done this since the 2nd tx nag my throat and mouth sores have minimized tremendiously since....I only have an occasional sore one...
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2011 02:58AM moe0279 wrote: Hi girls...i finished my 3rd tx yesterday of taxol/avastin...thankfully i had no reactions this time...is it normal for it to take 7-8 hours to finish a treatment...I haven't had one less than that...i did have great nurses who made my experence great...spent the the day with my mom who is amazingly wonderful..Going back to work today for the first time since Christmas vacation..alittle nervous, but excited to see my students...wondering who they are going to react to my short hair, it was long...lol I can here one little boy  say "oooh Mrs. Parker"... Hope everyone has a wonderful day!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2011 11:01AM moe0279 wrote: blindside, thanks for all the info! its helps me bunches! Glutamine helps with the neopathy, mouth sores that comes with taxol...i have not had any major symptons except burning sensations...but my Clinical Nurse suggested it for me...she said it could mininmze the long term effects of the taxol..so im willing to anything!!!!

Posts.Content: Apr 23, 2011 03:20PM moe0279 wrote: I have 2 more AC treatments and then im finished..its the thought of having the "red devil" again...its weird, i know its all in my head, but AC has been extremly tough...with taxol i only missed 2 days of work, and now I've miss the whole week of treatment....tuesday to friday...ugg..
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: Apr 23, 2011 07:51PM moe0279 wrote: JulieH i agree...this is probably the hardest thing ive done...i feel like the bad apple coming and complaining..but you ladies always  make me feel better...thanks!   Working on the off week has been good...i really dislike being off on the treatment week....but i know its best for me to follow my bodies que's.  it took me going to work and being so sick and leaving early to realize it was best to go ahead and plan for these days off...My principal had my subs on call for me those first 2 weeks...(great principal!) which was handy, but i felt bad when I had to call in anyway! I hope everyone has a wonderful Happy Easter!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: May 2, 2011 09:20PM moe0279 wrote: CONGRATULATIONS to all who have finished treatment and/or getting close..   Hi ladies its been a while since i last posted.  I had my 3 tx of dd AC and its completely kicking my butt again...I find myself absolutely breaking down at the the thought of the next go (may 10th). Im having to let go of not being able to work, but the hardest part is the lack of time away from my kiddos...since last tuesday I have basically slept, if im not im either throwing up or nauseated.. I call my onco today and now they are giving me 16 mg of steriods a day for the next 3 days to get me over the hump of this week.   They even suggested that we may not complete the last treatment.  which i have to say is ok with me....I can't seem to get past all the head stuff...i have never felt this way before...so my stress and anxiety is over the top and the only time i get piece from it is when im sleeping...I take the ativan at night, does anyone else take ambien too...Im afraid to take it too, and I forgot to ask today.    I can't wait until next week to see what the final decision is about this last treatment and then on to surgery , then rads...
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

CONGRATS BDAVIS....we did it!

Posts.Content: Aug 18, 2011 08:31PM moe0279 wrote: Ladies thanks for all the replies...period still going hot and heavy....lol , gyn and onco put me on a hormone for 10 days to stop the heavy bleeding so we could do a endrometrial biopsy.  I dislike taking this hormone because one of the side effects is breast cancer, but i know its the only way to make sure nothing is going on.  I agree with those of you who want to have their period back, I do not plan on any more children (i have 2 precious boys 7 and 4), but im ready for normal again...does anyone know if radiation can effect periods...
Posts.Title: Monthly Periods moe0279 LeapFrog39

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2011 11:40PM moe0279 wrote: girls, today was my first day out in public with my shaved head...it was the hardest day yet!  Friday night i noticed that hairs were plucking to easy...usually there's some resistance and i told myself that its coming  so around day 25 with taxol and avastin my hair actually started falling out! longer than i expected...for me the anticipation of it falling out was worse than actually shaving it, but that seems to hold true for most things dealing with BC (so far)! Well today was definitely the hardest....I couldnt decide what I wnated to wear, Hat? wig?, or scarf?  I kept telling myself i should wear a wig so I don't freak my students out at school (my Students with autism don't usually like change), so in the end i decided on a wig...different color and different style, but i like it alot! for the first little while i didnt even leave my room, but after a while i got brave and went out into the school and everyone was wonderful..they built my confidence and made me feel beautiful...today i left at 11:30 and i quickly took that wig off driving down the road...it was itchy and annoying...I even wore a wig cap under it and it made it worse...hope know one was watching, if so, i would love to have seen that expression!!!LOL Once i got home, i tried a pink scarf and love it...i felt so much better and more confident...so for now ive decided to try hats and scarves...I do have the wigs so that gives me more of a selection..ann97 i agree, i felt the same as you...just didn't feel right...but wear the bandana out i felt more me and natural...one of these days i hope to be brave enough to go without anything! Thanks for listening to me ramble, just needed to get it all out of my head...I hope everyone has a wonderful day tomorrow!!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jan 23, 2011 09:35AM moe0279 wrote: Oh basis, I completely understand the pity stares. I was sitting in the car at a store yesterday while my dh went in and this older women stared for at least 5minutes...then when her hubby came out he started waving at my kiddos. I just had to giggle because I know they were saying oh that poor woman with two young kids...I really just want to let people know that just because I have BC I'm not going anywhere!

Posts.Content: moe0279 wrote: Hi ladies, I need to know if this is normal or some what common.  Im 32 yrs old and finished chemo May 10.  June i had my first period which lasted 18 days, extremely heavy, using both tampon and overnight pads, change at least 3-4 times a day.  This month I started  about the same time July 15ish...and its the same...and not slowing down.  Should i be worried, or is this just the effects of chemo..I can't seem to keep up with it...I know this is a yucky subject, but i need some help and advice from all my BC sisters!!!  Thanks bunches! :) Melissa Dx 11/19/2010, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 1/11 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Dec 7, 2010 12:30AM moe0279 wrote: Wow, im glad i found this board...Im a special education teacher for children with autism...I love my job but wonder if maybe it may be too much..Sometimes my students can me aggressive and physical..Plus they are always sick with yucky noses I was diagnosed 11-19 and my oncologist suggested me plan on 12 weeks off...I stress over this...my babes need consistency and i fear that this will cause more issues for them..separation anxiety, etc...I know i have to put myself first, but it worries me... I did get a flu shot and have a dental appt.  to get everything settled ..
Posts.Title: newly diagnosed looking for elementary teachers AnnetteS Claire82

Posts.Content: Dec 7, 2010 03:37AM moe0279 wrote: My plan is not absolute yet...I have seen 1 oncologist and she mentions surgery first, chemo, then possibly rads. after that...depending on node involvement... My students range from 5 to 10...probably won't go into details, just let them know im sick and have to go to the dr. lots...  Putting out fires is a norm everyday...but most of my kiddos haven't had another teacher..i have a self contained/resource classroom...I know they will handle because there is no choice, but it breaks my heart to put them thru that... Claire-coming to the TN feed...been there and read some...Thanks for the invite...

Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2011 12:19PM moe0279 wrote: kcmomx3, im going thru the same thing..im on taxol #6 and ive gained 10 lbs in 2 weeks...urrg so frustrating...everyone keeps saying don't worry about it, but its hard when your face and tummy is bloated  and i look like a puffer fish.. Ive tried drinking my 8 glasses of water each day, and cutting back my food intake, but i will tell you when i get the munches i get them and want to eat...soooo of course i eat... I hate to say it, i thought that i could at least loose weight if i was going to have cancer...but i guess God has other plans...ive started walking a mile a couple days a week as i can...im willing to try anything at this point, i don't have enough $$$ to go out an buy new clothes along with all the dr visits and meds....Maybe we can loose together!
Posts.Title: Steroid weight gain Pinkprincess lisa2012
